filmJson.name: Biograph and Mutograph
filmJson.format2: Intermittent film movement was by friction rollers
filmJson.developedBy: William Kennedy Dickson & Herman Casler (Biograph Company)
filmJson.fact1: The Mutograph was the recording camera and the Biograph was the name of the projector
filmJson.fact2: Early versions of this camera used a larger format to avoid Edison's early motion picture patents
filmJson.fact3: This format had no sprocket holes, unless they were added to help projection
